byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

abstract: In its latest foray into software acquisitions, Intel agreed on Sunday to buy Telmap, an Israeli maker of map software.
snippet: In its latest foray into software acquisitions, Intel agreed on Sunday to buy Telmap, an Israeli maker of map software.
lead_paragraph: In its latest foray into software acquisitions, Intel agreed on Sunday to buy Telmap, an Israeli maker of map software. The price was not disclosed, though Israeli media reported that the deal was worth about $300 million to $350 million, according to Reuters. Read more »
